# Data Access and Integration

Connecting to databases, working with APIs, importing and exporting data, and transferring files between systems. These solutions bridge the gap between where data lives and where it needs to go.

::: {.callout-note title="Solutions Coming Soon"}
This part of the book will be populated as solutions are developed through the [Automation Clinic intake process](01-automation-intake.qmd). Each solution will be published as a subchapter below.

Have a data access or integration problem? **[Submit it to the clinic](https://forms.gle/cmE2un2njSVPid8C9){target="_blank"}**.
:::

## What Belongs Here

Solutions in this part address tasks involving data movement between systems:

- **API integration** with services like [Google Sheets](https://developers.google.com/sheets/api), [REDCap](https://www.project-redcap.org/), and CDC data portals (e.g., [CDC WONDER](https://wonder.cdc.gov/), [data.cdc.gov](https://data.cdc.gov/))
- **Database connections** to read from or write to SQL databases, Access files, or other structured data stores
- **Automated data downloads** from web portals, FTP servers, or shared drives
- **Data uploads and submissions** to reporting systems or partner agencies
- **File transfer automation** between local systems, network drives, and cloud storage
- **Web scraping** of publicly available health data from government websites
